text: September is #SickleCellAwarenessMonth. Today, I spoke on the House floor to acknowledge the patients, advocates, and healthcare workers who are fighting this disease every day. https://t.co/ZddXKJJWA6

Today, we celebrate the 78th birthday of the U.S. Air Force. Thank you to everyone who has served and continues to serve our country. I also want to celebrate the Tuskegee Airmen, whose heroism shaped history and the Air Force into what it is today.
.
.
.
📷: Maxwell Air Force Base & @NatlParkService
Join my team in Crenshaw County for mobile office hours Thursday from 12-3 pm CT. If you need assistance with a federal matter, come and learn more about how we can serve you. https://t.co/4yIp2y1yW9
Today is #NationalVoterRegistrationDay, Alabama! Now is a good time to check your information or get registered. Visit https://t.co/sElNNFK5fM for more details.

Today, I was saddened to hear of the passing of Reverend Thomas E. Jordan, a son of Montgomery and a pillar of his community. 

A testament to his legacy, Rev. Jordan was baptized and ordained by Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. At just 23, he became the pastor of The Lilly Baptist Church, where he served faithfully. I last saw Rev. Jordan at “The Lilly” this June, as he celebrated his 56th pastoral anniversary. His leadership from the pulpit and in the community left an impact on many lives, including mine.

I'm sending my deepest condolences to his family, his congregation, and everyone who knew such an incredible man.

62 years ago, four little girls were murdered in the 16th Street Baptist Church bombing. Today, we remember the beautiful lives of Carole Robertson, Denise McNair, Addie Mae Collins, and Cynthia Wesley, who were taken too soon, along with Sarah Collins Rudolph, who survived the bombing and continues to fight for justice.

My office has been in touch with Alabama State University and we will continue monitoring the situation. Keeping our students safe is the top priority. Local, state, and federal law enforcement are investigating these threats and actively looking for those responsible.

On September 11, 2001, I remember being in high school when the planes hit the Twin Towers. Watching the images of the attacks is something that will always stay with me. 24 years later, we continue to remember the lives lost that day, and honor the brave men and women who risked everything to save others and those who defended our country after the attacks.
As we enter the peak of hurricane season, I urge every family across the district to stay prepared. Please utilize resources at https://t.co/4lCV8oE6Ae #hurricaneseason2025

Every witness I questioned today at the House Ag subcommittee hearing on SNAP confirmed that Trump’s big, ugly bill gives states the power to cut off federal food assistance for everyone if the state does not cover the cost share. 

A very sad day in America. https://t.co/PHUX7B5JIo
Calling all high school seniors! Are you interested in attending a U.S. Service Academy? Join us on October 1 at 6 p.m. CT to learn more about the application process. https://t.co/4ljAS7N8Mc

Tune in at 4 PM ET to the House floor to see me pushing for passage of transportation bills ranging from improving mental health for pilots to creating a plan to address supply chain needs at ports, railroads, and trucking companies.

I couldn't miss the first ever night game at @TuskegeeUniv this weekend. Great game, Golden Tigers! https://t.co/Wz4089AgFu

Thank you, President Mohler and trustees for stopping by today. As a proud @UofAlabama alum, I’m excited about your vision for the university and the opportunities ahead for the entire UA community. Roll Tide! https://t.co/j8mRbHcgdR

Big news today! @transportdems passed the FEMA Reform Act, which includes my bipartisan bill to make disaster relief funding more accessible. This is a major step forward for the people in my district and other communities across the country. Check the link in my bio to see the full press release.

Having the U.S. Space Command in Huntsville is a win for the Rocket City and a win for Alabama. Huntsville has long been a leader in aerospace, and I believe the state has shown it can handle our nation’s space defense. This move will not only create high-quality jobs in the region, but will also bring significant investments that benefit the entire state.

Today, we celebrate America's workers - the backbone of this nation. I admire and respect those who are working hard to provide for themselves and their families. From our union members to our small business owners and entrepreneurs, today, we celebrate you, and the contributions you make to our country!

I've offered my office's assistance to ADEM and Macon County officials and have requested a briefing and regular updates from ADEM about this spill and their plans to ensure it is safely cleaned up to prevent health risks to residents in the area.

Montgomery, I want to hear from you! Please join me tomorrow at 6 p.m. for a town hall meeting at Resurrection Catholic School. https://t.co/5wc6lubIGq

So happy to have Amtrak back in the Port City, as this new route will transport passengers between Mobile and New Orleans. Special thank you to @RepRickLarsen for coming down to celebrate with us in the Second Congressional District of Alabama. https://t.co/k21GWTmwch
Join me for a town hall meeting in Montgomery at 6:00 pm CT on Tuesday at the Resurrection Catholic School. Check out the flyer for more information. https://t.co/c4CiNnqcQB

Today is National Intern Day! I want to shout out the amazing interns we had this summer: Jaleia, Braxton, and Vinya in DC, and Chasity in Montgomery. You all were incredible, and this is just the start. Thank you for being a part of the team! #nationalinternday https://t.co/o6mhdsEhQM

For 60 years, Medicare and Medicaid have been lifelines for millions of Americans, created out of necessity to ensure access to healthcare for seniors, families, and our most vulnerable. I'm committed to the fight to protect and expand these programs, especially for those in District 2 and across Alabama.  #Medicare60

Busy week in Washington fighting for the people in my district. I’m looking forward to getting around the district in August and talking with people about how I’ve been standing up, pushing back, and working hard for District 2! https://t.co/DoJLb4t72C

If it's green text, it must be from Rep. Figures.

We’re looking for all middle and high school students in Alabama's Second Congressional District interested in the Congressional App Challenge! You can create an app on any platform, using any coding language, for a chance to have your design displayed in the U.S. Capitol. The deadline to submit is October 30, 2025. For more information visit https://t.co/gqcKRP3UQX

This week, I introduced the bipartisan Building Resilient Infrastructure and Communities (BRIC) Act. This bill would change the law so that rural and natural disaster prone areas are prioritized to receive funding to strengthen their critical infrastructure. https://t.co/fhFGWPUe6N

Today, we introduced the Bipartisan Bridge Investment and Modernization Act to help extend and increase funding for Bridge Improvement Programs through 2031. This act can help complete many projects across America, including the 1-10 Bayway and Bridge in Mobile, not only improving local infrastructure but connecting communities and economies.

Almost 5 years since the passing of John Lewis, I reflect on the life and legacy of “The boy from Troy." In his absence, we must continue the fight for justice, learning from our past and building on his legacy; and in moments like this, we stand firm, keep the faith, and continue the struggle.
Happy Birthday to my wife! https://t.co/dLh1CBq94R
Today we introduced the bipartisan SCORE Act to establish a national framework for NIL in college athletics. Read more about the bill here: https://t.co/GrgNm5Wzab https://t.co/e4Pn8xvxME
Wishing everyone a safe and happy 4th of July! Let today be a reminder that we must keep fighting for freedom and justice for all. https://t.co/C7i3YwHZHG

I’m on the floor this morning supporting Leader @RepJeffries, who is speaking the truth about this trash bill. Republicans have the opportunity to do the right thing. But know that if they don’t, Dems will keep fighting for you because taking away health care from 17 million people ain’t right.
This big ugly bill is trash. It prioritizes the rich at the expense of everyday Alabamians and everyday Americans. That's why I’m voting no. https://t.co/G8VsRni1EF

Protecting SNAP and Medicaid is not about politics. We are not in a position where we can’t afford it. We are spending almost $4 million on every trip that Donald Trump takes to Mar-a-Lago.
 
It’s not a question of resources. It’s a question of priorities. https://t.co/hBbFgN9lKp

Juneteenth is a reminder of how far Black people have come in this country. It's a reminder of the darkest chapter in this nation's history and a time to reflect on the gratitude owed to those who endured, those who died, and those who fought to rid America of an inhumane foundational flaw. As we continue to fight for progress, never forget how far we've come. Happy Juneteenth!

Today, I had the opportunity to witness firsthand the hardwork and dedication Pike County is showing to prepare students to be the workforce of the future. The Troy-Pike Center for Technology and the Ag Academy at Goshen High School are creating real opportunities for students to be workforce ready immediately after school. These are the type of programs we must invest in!

Trump’s withdrawal from the Iran deal with no replacement allows Iran to get closer to having nuclear weapons, which threatens the security of Israel, the region, and the world. This Administration needs to show leadership and work with both sides and our international partners to de-escalate this situation while ensuring a non-nuclear Iran. This cannot become a broader conflict that risks more lives and involves American troops.

On this Father's Day, I'm thankful for my own father and father figures who stepped up in my life after my dad passed. I wouldn't trade being a dad for anything in the world! Happy Father's Day to all the incredible dads and father figures out there. Enjoy your day! https://t.co/DDelV6e00I

A special shoutout to Jackson McCoy, the 2025 Congressional Art Competition winner from Alabama's 2nd District! Jackson made a special visit to the Capitol to see his piece, "The Drunkard," which will be on display here for the next year. https://t.co/ZOXq0iFLox
Had a great time yesterday honoring two of Mobile’s finest- Hank Aaron and Satchel Paige. https://t.co/NuBih7wGQQ

Job Corps plays a vital role in workforce development, especially here in Alabama. I’m joining @stevenlouisreed and the staff of the Montgomery Job Corps to highlight the urgent need to restore full operations. Tune in NOW to watch https://t.co/IPzesGPNEK

It's definitely a disconnect somewhere. Why are we cutting Job Corps when we need to do everything we can to invest in our workforce in Alabama? Once again, this Administration is making decisions without considering the impact on Alabama and what we need here.

Today, we remember all those who gave their life in defense of this country. I went to high school with Pfc. Howard Johnson Jr., who died in Iraq in 2003. To him and all those we've lost - and to everyone who ever served - we say THANK YOU. https://t.co/i38bwcm8gG

Taking away access to Medicaid and SNAP for those who need it most just to benefit the very rich is not worth it, and it never will be. That’s why I voted no on the Republicans’ budget bill. https://t.co/OQNDSmJhmo
I’m saddened to hear of the passing of Rep. Gerry Connolly. He was truly a dedicated fighter and fierce advocate for his district and for federal workers. I’m praying for his family during this time.
This is simply ridiculous.
Wishing the best to President Biden as he tackles this challenge. I have no doubt he will fight cancer with everything he's got. 🙏🏽

Last night, Republicans made their priorities crystal clear: cut critical food assistance for families across this country just to make the rich even richer. Cutting $300B in SNAP will have devastating impacts for so many people who are already struggling to make ends meet. It's a shame, it's reckless, and it's a betrayal of the hardworking people who want us to make their lives better.

To all the incredible moms and mother figures out there, you uplift us, push us forward, and carry so much with grace.

Personally, I would not be in the position I'm in today if it weren't for the support of my wife and mother, the two most incredible moms I know. I love you. You deserve your flowers every single day. Happy Mother's Day!
Tuskegee Class of 2025, the world is yours to conquer. Go out and show them who you are! https://t.co/VQUQlqGGIb
This morning, I will be giving the commencement address at @TuskegeeUniv. Tune in at 9:30 a.m. CDT to watch: https://t.co/5Yee6Aw5GP

Today, I introduced the Land-Grant Institution Parity Act to ensure that all land-grant institutions are treated equally and that federal funding cannot be paused, cut, or eliminated without congressional approval. 

Earlier this year, the Trump administration suspended federal funding to only historically Black land-grant colleges, while not pausing funding for predominantly white land-grant colleges. This decision impacted schools like Alabama A&M University and Tuskegee University, so it is critical that we do everything we can to protect our HBCUs.

https://t.co/15B9QS9VTp

This Friday, my team will be in Russell County for mobile office hours from 1-4pm EDT. Come by the Russell County Courthouse if you need assistance with federal matters and learn more about how we can serve you. https://t.co/yrqwAl17PF

I am glad that the I-10 Bayway Bridge Project will finally receive the funding awarded by the Biden-Harris Administration. This $550 million grant will bring us closer to making this project a reality. https://t.co/0maoOG8pF6

Last week, I toured the Coca-Cola factory in Montgomery. It's always fun to go behind the scenes, connect with local workers, and witness firsthand how our district supports international brands. https://t.co/HICpDrvcHG

Only 2 days left! While we’re working on an extension, make sure to get your REAL ID by Wednesday if you plan on flying. Go get it before it’s too late. 
https://t.co/vhG9mpd4pB

GO GET YOUR REAL ID! The deadline to get a REAL ID is next Wednesday (May 7th). You need this to be able to use your driver's license to get through airport security and fly. 

I sent a letter w/my colleagues to the DHS Secretary requesting a six month extension to give people more flexibility to meet this new ID requirement. But as of now, May 7th is the deadline! Go get yours!
Congratulations to the Class of 2025; this is just the beginning. Now, let's get to work and change the world! https://t.co/0ADVp9PjvW

Rural communities are facing dire circumstances—especially in my district. Hospitals continue to close, effectively cutting off healthcare access and eliminating jobs for people across the country. This cannot continue. 
 
That is why I am introducing the bipartisan Rural Hospital Stabilization Act of 2025 with @RepBrianJack. This bill will provide critical funding to help rural hospitals remain open and serve the people who need it the most.

Tune in this morning as I speak on the House Floor to celebrate the life and legacy of hometown hero, friend, mentor, and trailblazer, former Secretary of Labor Alexis Herman.
https://t.co/buEamtE2Et

Today, I was saddened to learn of the death of a true hometown hero, legendary trailblazer, family friend, and mentor. Alexis Herman was a fighter for civil rights and women's rights, a giant in DC political circles, especially amongst Black women, and an all around dynamic woman.

Pope Francis had a commitment to standing up for the poor and the marginalized. He led with the humble heart of a true servant of Christ. His presence and leadership will truly be missed at a time where the world needs more of the humility, compassion, and decency he displayed every single day.

It’s always great to meet Alabama’s veterans. Their sacrifices can’t be forgotten, and I’m committed to making sure they can get the care and benefits they need and have earned. https://t.co/imzD55df6I

I joined my colleagues in the @DadsCaucus to highlight how bad Trump's tariffs are for working families. These tariffs make it harder for people to get by every single day, and this is happening while this administration and our Republican colleagues are seeking to take away benefits from the neediest Americans.
https://t.co/SkY68ipE3m

This is truly a shame. I'm heartbroken for this child, his mother and his family. I'm saddened and embarrassed that this happened where I grew up. And I'm outraged that yet another young Black man has taken the life of another young Black person. We must do better as a community and stop the cycle of violence. I'm begging yall to put these guns down and choose life paths that won't lead to another mother having to bury her child. This is not right and we can’t just accept this as normal.

This is what happens when the government listens to people. Last year, I heard from two Mobile County teachers, Sinjean Simmons and Kiala Burnette, that public school system employees do not get paid time off when they welcome a child into their family. This is now fixed in the state of Alabama. State Senator Vivian Figures led the charge, and Governor Ivey just signed into law paid parental leave for all state employees, including for employees who suffer miscarriages.

I could not be more proud of Sen. Cory Booker as he just broke the record for the longest filibuster in Senate history. The Trump Administration is taking our government apart piece by piece and moving us further and further away from being a democracy. We can’t continue business as usual. What they are doing is not normal. Thank you for speaking truth to power, @SenBooker !
I’m on the Senate floor where I’m supporting big bro @SenBooker speaking truth to power about the recklessness of the Trump administration.

Donald Trump wants to eliminate unions for the federal workforce. Both of my grandfathers were union men, so I know how important unions are to the workforce. We can’t stand for these attacks on their rights especially as Trump continues to fire federal workers. 
https://t.co/hgEGOi1EIE

These tariffs are yet another example of this administration acting without considering how it will impact everyday people, and most certainly not considering how it will affect people in industries in the state of Alabama.

https://t.co/agEnmA92Np
The stupidity continues, Trump just cut almost $200 MILLION from Alabama healthcare. Reminder: Alabama has basically the worst health outcomes in the country and this will make it worse.

This is like leaving children unsupervised in a utility shed to play with power tools. It is reckless, dangerous, and a serious lack of judgment.  Our intelligence leaders should be competent enough to know not to use unclassified platforms to discuss sensitive military plans because it can put American soldiers at risk. If Democrats did this, Republicans would be calling for them to be impeached and removed from office, so they should keep that same energy right now. Instead of blatantly lying to the American people, the Trump Administration should admit this is a security failure and hold people accountable for their actions.

I had great discussions with leaders in Russell County! We focused on strategies to enhance workforce development, create better broadband access, and improve transportation infrastructure. https://t.co/z7aKUBuOlO

This is stupid. Eliminating the Dept. of Education in the middle of college application season, creating doubt about the academic futures of students across America from kindergarten through graduate study without even concepts of a plan is yet another reckless decision by Trump.  #DonaldDoBetter

I met with the Rural Division of the Alabama Hospital Association to discuss how we can improve rural healthcare across the district. Too many communities have lost/are at risk of losing their hospital. This is unacceptable, and we are committed to saving our hospitals. https://t.co/d5swfV8T12

Thank you, to all the community leaders in Pike County, for meeting with me today. Our discussions focused on improving rural infrastructure, education, and keeping our rural hospitals open. https://t.co/4XgLgmDU8j

Mobile, I’m looking forward to answering your questions! Join me tonight for a townhall meeting at Bishop State Community College. Doors open at 6:30. If you can’t join in person, you can watch the livestream on Facebook. https://t.co/StxcJCn4wI
Thank you, Mayor Gordon Stone, for visiting me in D.C. and thank you for everything you are doing in Pike Road! https://t.co/5j724H4RRC

The Trump Administration wanted to sell the historic Montgomery Greyhound Bus Station, which houses the Freedom Rides Museum in my district. They have now reversed this decision.

I introduced legislation to protect civil rights landmarks on the National Register of Historic Places from being sold without congressional approval.  

Thank you to @RepTerriSewell for joining me in this fight. Our history is not for sale. Read the bill here: https://t.co/K5bHbMfTkD

NEWS: After pressure from me, @RepTerriSewell, and @RepJeffries, the Trump Administration has removed the Montgomery Bus Station, home of the Freedom Rides Museum, from the list of properties slated for sale. This never should have happened, and we will always fight to safeguard our history because civil rights history is also American history.
 
Read the full statement here: https://t.co/l7wO5mzJQs
Mobile, I want to hear from you! Join me for a townhall meeting at Bishop State Community College on Monday, March 17, at 7 p.m. https://t.co/TMjRYNtPyL
Thank you, Mayor Charles Andrews, for stopping by and for all that you do for the wonderful city of Monroeville! https://t.co/c3CvYcZj7A

This is crazy. Gutting half of the workforce that is responsible for providing student loans for millions of Americans to go to college, and protecting students' civil rights will not improve education. Tell me again how this puts people first?

I voted no on the Republicans’ continuing resolution because it: 

❌ Cuts $23B in medical care for veterans 
❌ Cuts food assistance for hundreds of thousands of seniors
❌ Cuts funding for disaster relief months before hurricane season, which directly impacts cities like Mobile that are frequently hit with natural disasters.
Read my full statement: https://t.co/g8iPqgPGhG

Thank you, Rev. Al, for letting me join the conversation moments after crossing the bridge on this historic anniversary. Alongside Rep. Sewell and Rep. Jackson, we discussed the legacy of Selma and what these times mean for Alabama and the country. Watch here: https://t.co/OiuQcNdF2e

It was great to be in Selma this past weekend to mark the 60th anniversary of Bloody Sunday. Walking across the Edmund Pettus Bridge, following in the footsteps of those who came before me, I was reminded that we must not let those foolish enough to yearn for the divisions of the past to erase the victories won by those who fought through the blood, sweat, and tears for an equitable America for all.

Thank you to my colleagues in Congress for visiting Selma to honor the 60-year legacy of the Edmund Pettus Bridge crossing. We must stand together to ensure that the struggles and triumphs of those before us are never forgotten. https://t.co/euHx1oijyi

Thanks to Roland Martin for having me on his show. We talked about fighting Elon Musk and DOGE from selling the Freedom Rides Museum in Montgomery and much more. Watch it here. https://t.co/0SKv8nbGIU https://t.co/nMughJFnJV

We have to stand up for Montgomery.
We have to stand up for our history.
And we have to stand up for this bus station with the same resolve that John Lewis and the Freedom Riders had in 1961. https://t.co/SfPq8VNLpT

The Freedom Riders played a pivotal role in the Civil Rights Movement. Trump and Elon want to sell the museum in Montgomery, Alabama that honors their legacy. Tune in NOW as I join @RepJeffries and @RepTerriSewell to demand they reverse this decision. https://t.co/s7IcrwjPhh
#HandsOffOurHistory

I’m in Selma, Alabama for the 60th anniversary of Bloody Sunday to honor the trailblazers who fought for the right to vote. It was great to speak with so many people about my fight to protect civil rights and improve the lives of everyday Americans. https://t.co/khpNRutMj5

I will always stand up for voting rights and do everything I can to protect the sacrifices that were made by Congressman John Lewis and so many others. I am proud to stand with my colleagues to introduce this bill to ensure every eligible voter can vote and have their vote counted.

I am saddened to hear of the passing of Congressman Sylvester Turner. I had the privilege of coming into Congress with Sylvester, and it never felt right to call someone with such an extensive career a freshman. He was a man with such an impressive story, from humble beginnings in Texas, to Harvard Law School, to the mayor of one of America's largest cities, to becoming a member of Congress. A soft-spoken man with a powerful impact, I am blessed to have had the chance to know and work with him. My prayers are with his family and constituents during this difficult time.

The President’s speech last night was just more rambling lies with no care or concern for everyday people. Touting policies like retaliatory tariffs that do nothing but drive up costs for consumers and businesses. Putting critical programs like Medicaid and SNAP on the chopping block while making the ultra wealthy even richer. It’s clear this Administration will continue to ignore the needs of the everyday Americans.

Unlike the Republicans, I am not afraid to hear from my constituents about the issues that matter most to them. Join me for a town hall meeting on Thursday, March 6, at 7 p.m. CT, in Montgomery at Alabama State University. https://t.co/PI3cfSdtMB
From the original home of Mardi Gras, Laissez les bons temps rouler ⚜️ https://t.co/0og4pTIyPl

Watching President Trump and VP Vance talk down to President Zelensky in the Oval Office was embarrassing.

Trump and Vance should show some respect to a wartime leader who is routinely on the front lines defending democracy against a dictator. Instead, Trump is trying to extort Ukraine out of their mineral rights to make his friends rich. 

To President Zelensky—you deserved better. Stay strong and keep fighting. True lovers of democracy have your back.
Black History is American history, and we must remember that our history is still being written. Therefore, we owe it to those who came before us to protect it. https://t.co/wNIdR1RHLA
I had a great time meeting and reading to students at Florence Howard Elementary; it’s great to be back! https://t.co/e5FNrusl1W

There are millions of Haitian Americans—including my wife and her family—who make vital contributions to this country every single day. For us to turn our backs on them now, it’s simply not right. It is indecent. It is inhumane. And quite frankly, it is un-American. I urge the Trump Administration to reconsider its restriction on TPS and extend the protection for the Haitians that are in America.
Read my full statement on why I voted against the House Republicans’ budget bill. https://t.co/EzO1wvbnOF

The House Republicans’ budget bill is bad for Alabama’s Second Congressional District. 

This budget cuts vital programs like Medicaid and SNAP while adding at least $2 trillion to our national debt and giving tax breaks to the ultra-wealthy. 

If you show me where you spend your time and your money, I will show you your priorities. It is clear from this budget that the everyday Americans in Alabama are not a priority. I’m voting against it.

Taking federal funds from students at HBCUs sends a clear message to not just those students, but to the entire Black community: We don’t care about you, your schools, or your future. This decision must be reversed immediately. @TuskegeeUniv @aamuedu, as the only land grant HBCUs in the state, we stand with you. https://t.co/3gfLD7KXaq
This decision is heartless and obviously not based on the facts of what is currently happening in Haiti. The president should reverse it immediately.

This policy forces hundreds of thousands of people back to a country to face life-or-death situations. The Temporary Protected Status program was precisely designed to protect the people fleeing from the situation they are being forced to return to.

To remove the protected status of lawful immigrants to force them to return to a war zone is irresponsible and inhumane. Haiti is in the middle of a humanitarian crisis—everything from gang violence to food insecurity. 

https://t.co/OadVB4bDUU

This month we celebrate and reflect on the invaluable contributions by Black Americans to this nation. As the first Black representative for Alabama’s 2nd Congressional District, I am honored to stand on the shoulders of giants who fought tirelessly for justice and equality. Their sacrifices were not in vain. Together, let us recommit ourselves to upholding their legacies to ensure they are remembered for generations to come. #HappyBlackHistoryMonth!

Today, I had the privilege of joining the Alabama Port Authority for a tour of the port in Mobile. It's always great to witness firsthand the essential operations that keep our economy moving. I’m proud to support our local industry and workers and advocate for the growth and safety of Alabama's ports!

Ensuring qualified candidates have a fair chance in employment had nothing to do with last night’s tragic plane crash. President Trump's statements are classic race baiting, and that rhetoric is dangerous and unacceptable. The Trump Administration should spend more time bringing the country together during this time of mourning and supporting the families of victims, investigators, and the first responders who are still trying to recover victims of this horrific tragedy.

President Trump's Executive Order to freeze federal funding is another example of a self-inflicted disaster. Issuing vague guidance leaves the impact and implementation open for interpretation. The WH is "unsure" if this EO will shut down access to Medicaid, which affects tens of millions of Americans. I urge President Trump to reverse course so that the American people are not negatively impacted by this decision.

The Air Force removing the Tuskegee Airmen from training videos is pathetic, disgraceful, and disrespectful, not only to the brave fighter pilots who saved the Allied Forces in World War II, but to the City of Tuskegee and the entire State of Alabama. It is a slap in the face of the heroic Black men who risked and sacrificed their lives on the front lines in defense of a country that still made them sit in the back of the bus when they returned home.

The Tuskegee Airmen fought for a freedom abroad that they didn't even have at home, and they did it with such a high level of courage, bravery, and skill that they became the most famous fighter pilots in the history of the United States Air Force and the world. The standard of excellence they set deserves to be honored.

I will be sending a letter to the Air Force calling for the restoration of the Tuskegee Airmen to their rightful place of recognition in the Air Force's training process, and it is my hope that calling for the restoration of this
Alabama History will be a bipartisan effort.
Alabama has substantial infrastructure needs, and I am dedicated to advancing legislation that will bring the resources home to move our District and our State forward. https://t.co/rcISXOiHFY

A Dream Deferred and A Promise Fulfilled.

As we celebrate the legacy of Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr., I reflect on the lasting impact he made not only on this country and the world but also on the great state of Alabama. I would not be in my position if Dr. King had not marched in Selma, boycotted in Montgomery, and resisted in Birmingham. 

I strive to fulfill the dreams Dr. King spoke of, not just for myself and my family but for all the people of Alabama.

This is dedicated to the home team.
